intro: Draba cinerea var. ladogensis, commonly known as the gray rockcress, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, cruciform flowers and capsule fruits. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in well-drained soils. It has hairy, grayish foliage that helps reduce water loss in arid conditions. This variety is distinguished by its specific geographic distribution and unique morphological adaptations to its harsh habitat.
